Write-Up Text: Australian social media users are divided on the 2023 Federal Budget. Economists and the media were criticised for lack of criticism on whether Josh Frydenburg's extra spending in the last budget would be inflationary which it now appears to have been. The budget has not made a significant impact on housing but it has enabled more Australians to apply for assistance in purchasing a new property. The budget predicts that the post-pandemic surge in net overseas migration will be temporary. However some social media users are critical of the $368b allocation for nuclear submarines.
